thread.title: Arsenal claim English title with Bayern thumping
thread.title_full: Arsenal claim English title with Bayern thumping

title: Arsenal claim English title with Bayern thumping
text:
— OptaJean (@OptaJean) February 15, 2017 
ANCELOTTI BACKS WENGER TO BEAT ARSENAL SLUMP 
One person who doesn’t think Wenger’s career at The Emirates is finished is his opponent, Bayern Munich coach Carlo Ancelotti. 
Ancelotti believes the Frenchman has the experience to pull Arsenal out of the mire as they stare down the barrel of a seventh last-16 exit in consecutive seasons. 
“This is football, Arsene has the experience to manage this result and move forward -- this is only one game,” said Ancelotti, who oversaw his 148th European game. Arsenal's manager Arsene Wenger. Source: AP 
BENZEMA BECOMES TOP FRENCH GOALSCORER IN UCL 
Real Madrid boss Zinedine Zidane hailed the impact of Karim Benzema after his compatriot lifted the European champions from the early blow of conceding to beat Napoli 3-1. 
Benzema’s goal moved him ahead of compatriot Thierry Henry as top French scorer of all-time in the Champions League proper. 
Despite fierce criticism of late from the Spanish press, the Frenchman headed home his 51st Champions League goal to equalise before second-half strikes from Toni Kroos and Casemiro gave Madrid a commanding lead. 
“I am always happy with him, said Zidane. 
“He needed that goal which lately he didin’t get, but I am happy not only for the goal but also for how he played generally. He made the rest of the team play better and his movement is very good. 
“The performances of Karim, Cristiano (Ronaldo), James (Rodriguez) they all made the rest of the team better.” Real Madrid's Karim Benzema celebrates after scoring. Source: AP 
CASEMIRO ON VOLLEY: I’M LOST FOR WORDS 
Real Madrid’s Casemiro is known for his defensive work but against Napoli he rocketed a volley to help him earn the Man of the Match honours. 
After the game, he simply said he wanted to kick the ball as hard as he could past Pepe Reina. 
“I’m lost for words,” he said. “When I struck the ball I wanted to smash it, for the game, for the fans, for the Bernabeu. I love to play here, I can’t say any more than that.” 
But he’s been waiting for his moment. He’s previously told Marca that he’s: “been practicing those kinds of shots a lot.” Real fight back past Napoli 0:57 
NEYMAR: CHAMPIONS LEAGUE PROGRESS NEAR IMPOSSIBLE 
Barcelona’s Brazil star Neymar says it will be a virtual ‘mission impossible’ for the Spanish giants to progress in the Champions League after their 4-0 first leg demolition by Paris Saint-Germain. 
No team has ever come back from a 4-0 first leg deficit to remain in the Champions League and Barcelona are under no illusions about the mountain they will have to climb for the second leg of the last 16 clash at Camp Nou on March 8. 
“Now we have to think about the return match and see what we can try to do to reverse this situation,” the Brazilian star told journalists. Barcelona's Brazilian forward Neymar (C). Source: AFP 
“But it will be very difficult, practically impossible. However, we can’t give up. 
“It will be very difficult to prepare for the return match, with a four-goal deficit. I don’t think this has ever happened to me.” He said that Barcelona had not prepared well for the game but were still surprised by the punishment they had received. 
“We were not good, we did not do our work as we should have done and we were surprised by this result,” he said. 
The joint heaviest defeat in coach Enrique’s three seasons in charge means Barcelona face missing out on the quarter-finals for the first time since losing on away goals to Liverpool in the last 16 in 2006/07. Barca thrashed by PSG 1:55 
ENRIQUE LAMBASTED FOR BARCA’S PSG THRASHING 
Barcelona coach Luis Enrique floundered in the firing line on Wednesday after what he called a “disastrous” 4-0 defeat to Paris Saint-Germain left the Spanish champions on the brink of their earliest Champions League exit in a decade. 
Enrique confronted a television reporter working for Catalan station TV3 after the match, whilst his tactics were criticised by Barca midfielder Sergio Busquets. FC Barcelona coach Luis Enrique. Source: AFP 
Barcelona sports daily Sport’s front cover said “this is not Barca,” whilst Madrid-based AS’s headline ran “total disaster.” Sport described Barca as a “shipwreck without a coach”. 
“Barca fell in Paris without grandeur and without excuses,” continued Sport’s editorial. 
“It was a tumultuous fall, from the first minute to the last...more than an accident, it manifested itself as an aggravation of many problems, some latent and others evident, that had already been shown up throughout the season.” 
  from AFP
